titleStmt.title: Vox clamantis. Mark 1. 3 A stil voice, to the three thrice-honourable estates of Parliament: and in them, to all the soules of this our nation, of what state or condition soeuer they be. By William Loe, Doctor of Diuinitie, and chaplaine to the Kings most excellent Maiestie.
titleStmt.author: Loe, William, d. 1645.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A06196 of text S108813 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 16691). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 150 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 46 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: Vox clamantis. Mark 1. 3 A stil voice, to the three thrice-honourable estates of Parliament: and in them, to all the soules of this our nation, of what state or condition soeuer they be. By William Loe, Doctor of Diuinitie, and chaplaine to the Kings most excellent Maiestie.
titleStmt.author: Loe, William, d. 1645.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T[homas] S[nodham] for Iohn Teage, and are to be sold at the signe of the Golden-Ball in Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: The first leaf is blank except for signature-mark "[fleuron]".
Running title reads: A still voyce, to the three estates of Parliament.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
